title: Michael Faraday discovered the rotation of the polarization plane of linearly polarized light propagating parallel to magnetic field lines
Pasteur described hemihedral crystals that exhibit optical activity
Herapath, using iodine and quinine, made a synthetic crystal with very high dichroism, which was the first step on the way to the construction of simple sheet polarizers
Sir George Stokes described the four parameters that define the properties of a light beam and that now bear his name
Liais, a French astronomer, while observing a solar eclipse, discovered that the light from the solar corona was partially linearly polarized
Kirchhoff found that incandescent tourmaline emits polarized light according to the radiation law that he also formulated
T^ndall established the fact that the polarization characteristics of light scattered by particles were strongly dependent on the particles' size
Strutt) began his studies of the polarization of the blue sky
1872 Lord Rosse discovered some polarization on Venus
Wright discovered the polarization of zodiacal light
Kiessling recorded that the glory is polarized
Cornu found that artificial haloes in sodium nitrate crystals are highly polarized
Zeeman discovered the broadening of spectral lines when radiating atoms are in the presence of an intense magnetic field. He later observed the splitting of spectral lines by magnetic fields and
Umov described the relationship between the degree of polarization of light reflected from rough surfaces and the albedo of the surface
G.E. Hale, by using polarization measurements of the Zeeman effect, discovered the existence of strong magnetic fields in sunspots
Debye independently developed the theory of scattering of a plane wave from a sphere of arbitrary size
Michelson discovered that certain beetles have a gloss that is circularly polarized

note: reported that scattered light underwater is polarized.

title: Bricard found that supernumerary fog-bows shift when one looks at them through a linear filter that is then rotated
Ohman found polarization in the galaxy M31
Mueller developed an approach using a 4 X 4 matrix (Mueller matrix) to transform the four-component Stokes vector
H.C. van de Hulst gave the first feasible explanation of the glory and explained its polarization directions
Babcock discovered that certain A-type stars have strong magnetic fields
K. von Frisch discovered that bees are more capable than man of distinguishing polarized from unpolarized light and use this ability to orientate themselves

note: discovered linear interstellar polarization, and later published catalogs on polarized starlight.

title: Dombrovsy discovered the strong polarization of the Crab Nebula, which had been predicted a year earlier with synchrotron radiation by I.S
Shurcliff discovered that the human eye is also capable of distinguishing circularly polarized from unpolarized light
Sloanaker detected radio polarization of the Crab Nebula and were the first to measure the polarization of an extragalactic radio source in
Shakhovskoy found a variable polarization in early-type eclipsing binary (3 Lyrae stars
Serkowski detected strong polarization for Mira stars
Kemp discovered circular polarization on a white dwarf star, which led to a large number of findings of circular polarizations on planets, stars, and nebulas
Waterman demonstrated polarotaxis in certain marine organisms
